Vocabularies.Definition: n. 寓言
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Aesop's fables

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a person who is between 13 and 19 years old 青少年
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Those teenagers attend the local high school.

Vocabularies.Definition: use up or finish a supply of (sth.) 用完,耗尽
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I am afraid we will have run out of petrol.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a collection of papers on one subject 档案，卷宗
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Here's our file on Middle East.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. holder for loose papers 文件夹
n. (AmE) (兼营杂货的)药房
n. 一把;少量
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We invited 30 people, but only a handful (of them) came.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 柜台
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  You can buy antibiotics（抗生素）over the counter（不凭处方地）in this country.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  税
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  If you sell the painting you'll have to pay capital-gains（资本收益）tax (on it).

Vocabularies.Definition: with a feeling of great surprise or disbelief 惊讶地
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We watched in amazement as she tore up the contract and threw it in the bin（垃圾箱）.

Vocabularies.Definition: ad. not in very large quantity, size, etc. 不太多，不太大，适中
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Most of us want to drink modestly but well.

Vocabularies.Definition: (upset) vt. make (sb.) worry or feel unhappy 使苦恼，使心烦意乱
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Do what he wants, or you'll upset him.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. knowing little or nothing 无知的;不知道的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I'm afraid I'm rather ignorant about computers.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 无知;愚昧
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The workers are kept in complete ignorance of the company's financial situation.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. (AmE) student in the last year of college or high school (大学或中学)毕业班的学生
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  My son will be a senior in the fall of next year.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a part of sth.; a thin flat piece cut from sth. 部分;(薄薄的)一片
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They wanted to make sure they got a slice of the profits/of the market.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 能力
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She has demonstrated/has got a remarkable ability to get things done.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. not existing 不存在的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Their government is bankrupt, and public services are now practically nonexistent.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. become or make (sth. or sb.) cold (使)变冷;(使)不寒而栗
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Put the wine in the fridge（电冰箱）to chill.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. a lack of interest or feeling 漠不关心
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He treats her with complete indifference.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  合计;总结;概述 sum up 总结，概括
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The last section sums up all the arguments on either side.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. 竞争 compete with/against try to be better than (sb. else) 与...竞争
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She and her sister are always competing for attention.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.，a. 亚洲人;亚洲(人)的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His philosophy is a mixture of both Western and Asian thought.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. connected with money 财政的;金融的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The City of London is a great financial center.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. collect, or gather together, esp. over a period of time 积累，积聚
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He gradually accumulated an impressive collection of paintings.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 祖先，祖宗
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  My ancestors came from Spain.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 智力的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The argument was too intellectual for me; I couldn't follow a word of it.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. have an influence on 影响
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Will the strike affect the price of coal?

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 工业的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  an industrial country

Vocabularies.Definition: vi. operate; act 运作；起作用 n. 作用，功能
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The machine will not function property if it is not kept well-oiled.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. lazy; not doing anything 懒散的;空闲的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Owing to the electricity strike, a lot of factory workers were left idle.

Vocabularies.Definition: v. get stuck 发生故障;卡住;堵塞
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The bus was so full that I was jammed in and couldn't move.

Vocabularies.Definition: stop working; fail, collapse 停止运转;失败，垮了
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The car broke down.

Vocabularies.Definition: make (sth.) clear so that people understand it 使清楚无误地理解
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Peter was lazy. His parents tried to drive home to him the importance of hard work.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 谦卑的;卑微的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He rose from humble origins to become prime minister.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  sth. suggested 建议
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Your suggestions are unworkable.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. film 电影
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  There's a good movie on the TV tonight.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. write (sth.) again in a form which can be performed 将...改编为剧本，将...戏剧化
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He's dramatizing his novel for television.

Vocabularies.Definition: a., n. 欧洲(人)的;欧洲人
a. light and small enough to be easily carried or moved 便携(式)的，手提(式)的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Professor Smith always carries a portable computer with him.

Vocabularies.Definition: = compact disc 激光唱片;(计算机用的)光盘
n. (英国的)郡;(美国的)县
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  A county usually consists of several towns and the rural areas that surround them.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 小屋;棚屋
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They lived in a mud hut.

Vocabularies.Definition: look for 寻找
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Scientists are still searching for a cure to the common cold.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 工资，工钱
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  In our family both my husband and I are wage earners (= have a job and earn money).

Vocabularies.Definition: n. the state of being poor 贫穷，贫困
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They live in abject poverty / below the poverty line.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. spare time 空闲，闲暇
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She's very busy; she doesn't get much leisure(time).

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  奢侈品;奢华;奢侈
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Cream cakes are a luxury in our house.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  a factory 工厂，制造厂
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Paper is made in a paper mill.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. (AmE) underground railway 地铁
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  It might be better to go by subway.

Vocabularies.Definition: richer; more comfortable 更富有;更舒服
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  It's obvious that those who work hard are better off than those who don't.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. (lit) an enemy 敌人
v. frighten (使)惊慌，(使)恐惧
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Don't let the noise scare you; it's only the wind.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 散兵坑(小型掩体)
n.  the state of feeling safe and free from worry 安全
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Once the jewels were safely locked up in the bank he had no more anxieties about their security.

Vocabularies.Definition: stop sleeping 醒了
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I woke up with a start when the alarm rang.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. (旅馆、火车站等的)搬行李工人; 搬运工人
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We tipped（付小费给）the porter for each box.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. rich; having wealth 富的，富裕的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His father is very wealthy.

Vocabularies.Definition: a.not simple 复杂的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  a complex machine / system / network / theory

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 体力的;手工做的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Nowadays, young people don't like manual work.

Vocabularies.Definition: a. enough 充分的，足够的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The city's water supply is no longer adequate (for its needs).

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 贫民窟
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The mayor promised to clean up the slums.

Vocabularies.Definition: n.  (水、煤气等)管道设施
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  an old house with noisy plumbing

Vocabularies.Definition: n. the state of being alone and undisturbed (不受干扰的)独处;隐私，隐秘
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  There's not much privacy in these flats because of the large windows and thin walls.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. (AmE)  垃圾;废物
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Mother told me to put out the trash.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. help; act as a friend to 帮助;以朋友态度对待
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  They befriended me when I first arrived in London as a student.

Vocabularies.Definition: vi.,n. 衰败，衰退;下降
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  His influence declined as he grew older.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. get 取得，获得
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  I managed to acquire two tickets for the concert.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 废墟;灰,灰烬
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The house was burnt to ashes.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt. surprise very much 使惊讶
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  We were all astonished by the news / astonished to hear that he had passed his driving test.

Vocabularies.Definition: vt.  (swore, sworn) make a serious promise about 发誓，宣誓
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  The witness swore to tell the truth.

Vocabularies.Definition: earn money by (doing sth.) 靠...维持生计
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He makes a good living (= earns a lot of money) by selling insurance.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 奇迹
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  It's a miracle you weren't killed!

Vocabularies.Definition: n. any of the powers of the body or mind 官能
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  He has lost the use of his limbs but he is still in possession of all his faculties. (= can think, see, hear, etc.)

Vocabularies.Definition: a. 令人鄙视的，可轻蔑的
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  That was a contemptible trick to play on a friend!

Vocabularies.Definition: n. 懦夫
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  She accused her husband of being a coward.

Vocabularies.Definition: n. (infml) father
Vocabularies.Paraphrase: e.g.  Can I borrow the car, pop?
